conclusion: Determine the electric field strength between the plates and the electric potential of point M.
The electric field E between two parallel plates can be calculated using the formula E = V/d.
Given V = 4 V and d = 10 mm = 0.01 m.
The electric field strength between the plates is 400 V/m.
The electric potential difference between two points in an electric field is given by V_MN = -E * d_MN.
Given E = 400 V/m and d_MN = 2 mm = 0.002 m.
Point M is closer to plate A and point N is closer to plate B; the direction of the electric field is from plate A to plate B.
The potential difference V_MN will be negative because the potential decreases as you move in the direction of the electric field.
The electric potential of point M relative to point N is -0.8 V.
The electric field strength between the plates is 400 V/m and the electric potential of point M relative to point N is -0.8 V.
